{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with weight gain, fatigue, and constipation, which are suggestive of hypothyroidism. The physical exam is unremarkable except for slightly dry skin, which can also be a sign of hypothyroidism. To confirm the diagnosis, thyroid function tests should be ordered. In hypothyroidism, the levels of T3 and T4 will be low, while TSH will be elevated as the body tries to stimulate the thyroid gland to produce more hormones. Therefore, the most likely elevated laboratory value in this patient is Thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH).", "answer_choice": "D"}
